com.invectorate.open.queutures

Interface Queuture<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of object being generated by the computation.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RunnableQueuture<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    QueutureTask

    public interface Queuture<V>
    A representation of the outcome of an arbitrary asynchronous computation that may generate many results. Conceptually very similar to a Future, a Queuture has many results, not just one. As these results are generated by a computation, they become available in a thread-safe way through the next() and next(long, TimeUnit) methods. As its name implies, a Queuture behaves very much like a BlockingQueue. Once an element is read from a Queuture in one thread, it is no longer available to any other consumers. To read all of the results from a Queuture: 
     Queuture<String> queuture = executorService.submit(...);
     StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
     
     String v;
     while((v = queuture.next()) != null)
         sb.append(v).append(" ");
 
     System.out.println(sb);
    Author:
    Noah Fontes

      • next

        V next()
       throws InterruptedException,
              ExecutionException
        Returns the next result of the asynchronous computation. If there are no more results to be returned, this method returns null. Subsequent calls to this method after computation is complete will always return null. This method will block until the next result is available, possibly indefinitely.
        Returns:
        The next result of the asynchronous computation, or null if there are no more results.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the next result.
        ExecutionException - If an error occurred during computation.

      • next

        V next(long timeout,
     TimeUnit unit)
       throws TimeoutException,
              InterruptedException,
              ExecutionException
        Returns the next result of the asynchronous computation, waiting up to a given timeout for it to become available. If there are no more results to be returned, this method returns null. Subsequent calls to this method after computation is complete will always return null. This method will block until the next result is available, or until the timeout has expired.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait.
        unit - The time unit of the timeout parameter.
        Returns:
        The next result of the asynchronous computation, or null if there are no more results.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - If the next result could not be computed within the constraints of the given timeout.
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the next result.
        ExecutionException - If an error occurred during computation.
